abstract: For the first time in a dozen years, our very own Wm. (Bill) Ferguson will perform with Lotion. They're good, but don't take our word for it. Take Thomas Pynchon's.

lead_paragraph: For the first time in a dozen years, our very own Wm. (Bill) Ferguson will perform with the great New York '90s indie-rock band Lotion, in which he played bass, with his brother Jim on guitar, Rob Youngberg on drums and Tony Zajkowski on vocals. The band's first album, ''Full Isaac,'' was voted album of the year by the Village Voice in 1994; they were one of the first recipients of Sassy magazine's ''cute band alert''; they toured with Pavement and Throwing Muses and Mercury Rev, and Thomas Pynchon wrote the liner notes, quoted below, for their 1996 album ''Nobody's Cool'':
